buffer_fill: This function can be used to fill a previously created buffer with a given data type and value. The data you fill the buffer with must be in agreement with the "type" argument of this function, meaning that you can't try to fill with a string and use the unsigned 16bit integer type, for example. The type constants are the same as those used by the buffer_read() and buffer_write() functions. The "size" is the size of the buffer (in bytes) that you wish to fill, while the offset is the offset value (also in bytes) from the start of the buffer to start the fill from.
